channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ID
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ID

item.title: Report X-2024060145
item.description:
Report X-2024060145

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-25
  • City: POST FALLS
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED ON THE EXTENDO ON DOOR 3, EMPLOYEE NOTICED THAT IT WAS LEAKING. THEY TURNED THE BELTS OFF AND NOTIFIED A SUPERVISOR WHO NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. UPON ARRIVING TO THE LEAKING PKG THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER INSPECTED AND THE ODOR WAS VERY NOXIOUS AND FOLLOWING HIS DECISION TREE NOTIFED THE SUPERVISOR AS WE DO NOT HAVE SCBA. THE AREA WAS CORDONED OFF AND WE OPENED ALL THE DOORS FOR VENTILATION. WE THEN NOTIFIED BASE AND AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO CLEANUP THE SPILL.

  • Description: This package had 4 1 gallon bottles of Delimer Advantage Chemicals. 1 of the caps was loose and 3 fl. oz. of the content spilled. The other 3 bottles were not damaged.
